topic.title: Maintaining &sudo; configuration files

abstract.para: The integrity of your system's &sudo; configuration is paramount. Errors in these files can compromise your entire system. The visudo command provides a safe and secure way to edit the &sudo; configuration.

topic.para: The main policy configuration file for &sudo; is /etc/sudoers. This file is supplied by the system packages and changes made to it may break updates. Therefore, create separate configuration files holding your custom settings under /etc/sudoers.d. These are pulled in by default by a directive in /etc/sudoers.

note.title: Ignored files in /etc/sudoers.d
note.para: The #includedir directive in /etc/sudoers ignores files that end with the ~ (tilde) character or contain the . (dot) character.
